|brand = Linksys |model = WRT120N |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = v1 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 03/16/2011 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/Linksys_WRT120N_v1.0 |wlclass = N150 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = wireless router |sernum = JUT0, JUT00 |fcc_id = Q87-WRT120N |icid = 3839A-WRT120N |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Atheros;AR7240;AR7240-AH1E; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24Kc |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 400 <!-- 350 / 400 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L1606E; |flash1size = 2 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = Winbond;W9425G6JH-5; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 00:25:9C,68:7F:74,98:FC:11 |oui = 00:25:9C,68:7F:74,98:FC:11
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = SuperTask!;;;
|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = <!-- Leave blank --> |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = linksys |defaultssid_regex = ^linksys$ |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Arcadyan |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 04/29/2009 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 745883587858 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0028N6VNW |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = blue |dimensions = 7.99" x 1.38" x 6.3" (203mm x 35mm x 160mm) |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9285;AR9285-AL1E; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "P/N: 141700520014J R0A2" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The serial number for this device may be prefixed with '''JUT0''' / '''JUT00'''.
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/30900-linksys-cisco-wrt120n-reviewed ''Linksys WRT120N'' Reviewed by '''SmallNetBuilder'''] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=55205 ''Linksys WRT120N supported ?'' on the '''DD-WRT''' forums] :(but lists processor and wireless chip part numbers) *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_routers Listed on the 'Linksys routers' page on '''Wikipedia''']
===Reverse engineering=== :''Craig'''s posts on '''/dev/ttyS0''' *[http://www.devttys0.com/2014/02/reversing-the-wrt120n-firmware-obfuscation/ ''Reversing the WRT120N’s Firmware Obfuscation''] (2014-02-02) *[http://www.devttys0.com/2014/02/re-enabling-jtag-and-debugging-the-wrt120n/ ''Re-enabling JTAG and Debugging the WRT120N''] (2014-02-05) **<small>notes the OS used as '''SuperTask!'''</small> *[http://www.devttys0.com/2014/02/cracking-linksys-crypto/ ''Cracking Linksys “Encryption”''] (2014-02-12) *[http://www.devttys0.com/2014/02/wrt120n-fprintf-stack-overflow/ ''WRT120N fprintf Stack Overflow''] (2014-02-19)
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== JP8 - 14 pin header (2 rows of 7 pins @ .1" spacing)
===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== JP3 - 10 pin header (2 rows of 5 pins @ .1" spacing)
==Pictures== <center>'''FCCID {{fccid|Q87-WRT120N}}''' <gallery> File:Q87-WRT120N 01.png| File:Q87-WRT120N 02.png| File:Q87-WRT120N 03.png| File:Q87-WRT120N 04.png| File:Q87-WRT120N 05.png| File:Q87-WRT120N 06.png| File:Q87-WRT120N 07.png| File:Q87-WRT120N 08.png| </gallery></center>[[Has images::fcc| ]]
